page.title: 02Merrow and Pewley Downs
page.content:
Many different types of animals and birds were found to be living in this area. Swallows, magpies, swifts, robins, thrushes, blackbirds, rabbits, foxes, badgers, hares and deer were there.
We also took soil samples from different areas on the slope. The soil consisted mainly of clay and chalk. Among the many types of flowers and grasses, the most common included foxgloves, dog-roses, brambles and scarlet pimpernels. The trees growing here included birch, fir and rowan.
People use this area to walk their dogs and stop for a break on their journey. Very few people complained about the area and most people believed it should be left untouched.
